page.title: 17Worlingworth Local History
page.content: Worlingworth has a 15th century church. It has several inhabited 16th century or earlier buildings including;farm houses,the Guild Hall(later the work- house),a maltings(now used for pigs) several barns & farm buildings.The village has a few tea ponds,old hedges, green lanes & water courses,all threat- ened by farming needs.several old greens were ploughed up during the 1939 /45 war & are now farmland or industrial sites.Old claylump cottages in Fingle St.Were demolished & the res- idents housed in council houses & given allotments in lieu of common rights.The village had many wartime evacuees,was hit by V bombs & machine gunned. Worlingworth had a railway station serving a local line but it closed in the 1950's.
